Package org.opensextant.xtext.collectors.mailbox

Class OutlookPSTCrawler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opensextant.xtext.collectors.mailbox.OutlookPSTCrawler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Collector

    public class OutlookPSTCrawler
extends Object
implements Collector
    OutlookPSTCrawler traverses a PST file and pulls out: E-Mail files + attachments, Contacts, Appointments, etc. saving originals in a reasonable folder structure. Mail in particular will be foldered by date-line, then short subject name folder. Given SomeFile.PST, the resultant output folder created will look like the example below. 
        SomeFile_PST/
      + Contacts
      + Appointments
      + Mail-Inbox
      +--2014-04-05
         +-- RE__Shipping_Invoice/
             +-- RE__Shipping_Invoice.eml
             +-- Invoice.PDF
    Supposedly on April 5th, 2014, an email was received (Mail-Inbox); titled "RE: Shipping Invoice". To make the archival of such content obvious, the subject line is converted to a safe folder/filename. Usage: crawler = OutlookPSTCrawler( path ) //crawer... set modes, set listener, converter, etc. crawler.configure() crawler.collect()
    Author:
    ubaldino

      • configure

        public void configure​()
               throws org.opensextant.ConfigException
        Beware -- you can set the path for the PST output (outputPSTDir) or you can set the path its parent path (outputDir). Outside apps may want to control the path setup. To use the default, setOutputDir(); configure();
        Throws:
        org.opensextant.ConfigException - if output folder could not be set

      • setConverter

        public void setConverter​(XText conversionManager)
        If a converter is provided, it will be used to convert attachments. PST API does not provide access to full email stream, so most objects - tasks, mail, contacts, etc. are retrieved as text already. Caller is responsible for mananging the XText caching options.
        Parameters:
        conversionManager - XText instance

      • createFolder

        protected File createFolder​(File container,
                            String msgSubj,
                            String msgId)
                     throws IOException
        An arbitrary method of finding a unique path for a MIME message, without opening up content on disk. This creates the folder if needed. TODO: given we want the folder structure to be intuitive and readable, the file names may not reflect uniqueness where subject lines for email may be repetitive. By contrast, message IDs are not duplicative. The length of file names from using both message ID and subject line is an issue. This routine attempts to get a relatively unique path using both.
        Parameters:
        container - output container relative path
        msgSubj - message subject
        msgId - message ID
        Returns:
        absolute path to file that will contain all related info for a given message.
        Throws:
        IOException - err
